edit /etc/hosts and make sure two first lines are like this 1. 127.0.0.1       localhost <hostname> 2. 127.0.1.1       <hostname>
cant sudo edit /etc/hosts cause sudo cant resolve host name
log into recovery mode
on grub menu there is an entry to boot the machine (ubuntu) in recovery mode
you will en on a terminal envoirment use "nano /etc/hosts" to edit the file
<hostname> is your actual hostname
the first 2 lines are: 127.0.0.1 localhost -and- 127.0.1.1 ubuntu.mydomain.co.za
add ubuntu.mydomain.co.za to the end of the first line sepparating it from localhost by a tab
